9.en: 17 And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, even Jesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.
9.lv: 17 Un Ananija aizgāja un iegāja namā; un uzlikdams viņam savas rokas sacīja, Brāli, Saul, tas Kungs, proti, Jēzus, kas tev parādījās ceļā tev nākot, ir mani sūtījis, lai tu varētu kļūt redzīgs un tikt pildīts ar Svēto Garu.

9.en: 18 And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.
9.lv: 18 Un uzreiz no viņa acīm nokrita kā zvīņas: un viņš tūlīt kļuva redzīgs un uzcēlās, un tika kristīts.

9.en: 19 And when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.
9.lv: 19 Un, kad viņš bija saņēmis barību, viņš tika stiprināts. Tad Sauls kādas dienas bija ar mācekļiem, kas bija Damaskā.

9.en: 20 And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.
9.lv: 20 Un nekavējoties viņš sinagogās sludināja Kristu, ka viņš ir Dieva Dēls.

9.en: 21 But all that heard him were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?
9.lv: 21 Bet visi, kas viņu dzirdēja, bija pārsteigti un sacīja; Vai šis nav tas, kas iznīcināja tos, kas sauca uz šo vārdu Jeruzālemē un nāca šurp ar tādu nodomu, lai viņš tos varētu vest saistītus pie virspriesteriem?

9.en: 22 But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.
9.lv: 22 Bet Sauls pieauga vairāk stiprumā un apmulsināja jūdus, kas mājoja Damaskā, pierādīdams, ka šis ir pats Kristus.

9.en: 23 And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:
9.lv:
23

Un pēc tam, kad daudzas dienas bija piepildītas, jūdi apspriedās viņu nokaut:

9.en: 24 But their laying await was known of Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.
9.lv: 24 Bet viņu glūnēšana bija zināma Saulam. Un tie uzraudzīja vārtus dienu un nakti, lai viņu nokautu.

9.en: 25 Then the disciples took him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket.
9.lv: 25 Tad mācekļi viņu ņēma pa nakti un viņu nolaida zemē gar mūri grozā.

9.en: 26 And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.
9.lv: 26 Un, kad Sauls bija nācis uz Jeruzālemi, viņš mēģināja pievienoties mācekļiem: bet tie visi baidījās no viņa un neticēja, ka viņš bija māceklis.

9.en: 27 But Barnabas took him, and brought him to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
9.lv: 27 Bet Barnabas viņu ņēma un veda pie apustuļiem, un tiem paziņoja, kā viņš ceļā bija redzējis to Kungu, un ka viņš ir uz to runājis, un kā viņš ir drošsirdīgi sludinājis Damaskā Jēzus vārdā.

9.en: 28 And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.
9.lv: 28 Un viņš bija pie tiem ienākot un izejot Jeruzālemē.

9.en: 29 And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.
9.lv: 29 Un viņš runāja drošsirdīgi Kunga Jēzus vārdā, un strīdējās ar grieķiem: bet tie apņēmās viņu nokaut.

9.en: 30 Which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.
9.lv: 30 Kad brāļi to uzzināja, tie viņu noveda uz Cēzareju un viņu izsūtīja uz Tarsu.

9.en: 31 Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.
9.lv: 31 Tad draudzēm bija dusa pa visu Jūdeju un Galileju, un Samariju, un [tās] tika uztaisītas; un staigādamas tā Kunga bijāšanā un Svētā Gara mierinājumā, vairojās.

9.en: 32 And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all quarters, he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.
9.lv:
32

Un notika, Pēterim ejot pa visām vietām, viņš nonāca arī pie svētajiem, kas mājoja Lidā.

9.en: 33 And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.
9.lv: 33 Un tur viņš atrada kādu vīru, vārdā Aenas, kurš bija gulējis uz savas gultas astoņus gadus, un bija paralizēts.

9.en: 34 And Peter said unto him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.
9.lv: 34 Un Pēteris viņam sacīja, Aenas, Jēzus Kristus tevi dara veselu: celies un saklāj savu gultu. Un viņš uzreiz uzcēlās.

9.en: 35 And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.
9.lv: 35 Un visi, kas mājoja Lidā un Saronā, redzēja viņu un griezās pie tā Kunga.

9.en: 36 Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.
9.lv:
36

Tad nu Jopā bija kāda mācekle, vārdā Tabita, kas tulkojumā tiek saukta Dorka: šī sieviete bija pilna labu darbu un žēlastības darbu, ko viņa darīja.

9.en: 37 And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid her in an upper chamber.
9.lv: 37 Un notika tajās dienās, ka viņa bija slima un nomira: kuru, kad tie bija mazgājuši, tie noguldīja augšējā kambarī.

9.en: 38 And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring him that he would not delay to come to them.
9.lv: 38 Un ņemot vērā, ka Lida bija tuvu Jopai, un mācekļi bija dzirdējuši, ka Pēteris tur bija, tie sūtīja pie viņa divus vīrus, viņu lūgdami, lai viņš nekavētos pie tiem nākt.

9.en: 39 Then Peter arose and went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.
9.lv: 39 Tad Pēteris uzcēlās un gāja ar tiem. Kad viņš bija nācis, tie viņu veda augšējā kambarī: un visas atraitnes stāvēja viņam blakus, raudādamas un rādīdamas svārkus un apģērbus, ko Dorka taisīja, kamēr viņa bija pie tiem.

9.en: 40 But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning him to the body said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
9.lv: 40 Bet Pēteris izlika viņas visas ārā un nometās zemē uz ceļiem, un lūdza; un pagriezdamies pie ķermeņa sacīja, Tabita, uzcelies. Un viņa atvēra savas acis: un, kad viņa redzēja Pēteri, viņa pacēlās sēdus.

9.en: 41 And he gave her his hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.
9.lv: 41 Un viņš viņai deva savu roku un viņu pacēla augšā, un, kad viņš bija aicinājis svētos un atraitnes, viņu stādīja priekšā dzīvu.

9.en: 42 And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.
9.lv: 42 Un tas tika zināms pa visu Jopi; un daudzi ticēja uz to Kungu.

9.en: 43 And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.
9.lv: 43 Un notika, ka viņš uzkavējās daudzas dienas Jopā pie kāda Sīmaņa, ādmiņa

10.en: 1 There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian band,
10.lv: 1 Cēzarejā bija kāds vīrs, saukts Kornēlijs, centurions grupai, kas saukta Itālijas grupa,

10.en: 2 A devout man, and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.
10.lv: 2 Dievticīgs un kāds, kas bīstas Dievu ar visu savu namu, kas ļaudīm deva daudz žēlastības dāvanas un vienmēr lūdza Dievam.

10.en: 3 He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.
10.lv: 3 Ap dienas devīto stundu viņš redzējumā skaidri redzēja Dieva eņģeli, ienākam pie viņa un viņam sakām, Kornēlij.

10.en: 4 And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.
10.lv: 4 Un, kad viņš uz to palūkojās, viņš izbijās un sacīja, Kas tas ir, Kungs? Un viņš tam sacīja, Tavas lūgšanas un tavas žēlastības dāvanas ir uznākušas par piemiņu Dieva priekšā.

10.en: 5 And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter:
10.lv: 5 Un nu sūti vīrus uz Jopi un aicini Sīmani, kura pavārds ir Pēteris:

10.en: 6 He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.
10.lv: 6 Viņš ir apmeties pie kāda Sīmaņa, ādmiņa, kura nams ir pie jūrmalas: viņš tev stāstīs, ko tev pienākas darīt.

10.en: 7 And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;
10.lv: 7 Un, kad eņģelis, kas runāja uz Kornēliju, bija aizgājis, viņš aicināja divus no savas saimes kalpiem un dievticīgu karavīru no tiem, kas viņu nepārtraukti apkalpoja;

10.en: 8 And when he had declared all these things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
10.lv: 8 Un, kad viņš to visu tiem bija paziņojis, viņš tos sūtīja uz Jopu.

10.en: 9 On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:
10.lv:
9

Un nākamajā dienā, tiem aizejot un tuvojoties pilsētai, Pēteris uzkāpa uz nama lūgt ap sesto stundu:

10.en: 10 And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,
10.lv: 10 Un viņš kļuva ļoti izsalcis, un gribēja ēst: bet kamēr tie sagatavoja, viņš iekrita transā,

10.en: 11 And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:
10.lv: 11 Un redzēja debesi atvērtu un kādu trauku nolaižamies uz viņu, it kā tas būtu liels palags, savienots pie četriem stūriem un nolaists uz zemes:

10.en: 12 Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
10.lv: 12 Kurā bija visa veida četrkājaini zemes zvēri un savvaļas zvēri, un rāpuļi, un gaisa putni.

10.en: 13 And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.
10.lv: 13 Un uz viņu nāca balss, Celies, Pēteri; nokauj un ēd.

10.en: 14 But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.
10.lv: 14 Bet Pēteris sacīja, Ne tā, Kungs; jo es nekad neesmu ēdis kaut ko, kas ir parasts vai nešķīsts.

10.en: 15 And the voice spake unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.
10.lv: 15 Un balss runāja atkal uz viņu otru reizi, Ko Dievs ir šķīstījis, to tev nebūs saukt par parastu.

10.en: 16 This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.
10.lv: 16 Šis tika darīts trīsreiz: un trauks atkal tika uzņemts debesī.

10.en: 17 Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon's house, and stood before the gate,
10.lv: 17 Tad nu, kamēr Pēteris šaubījās sevī, ko šis redzējums, ko viņš bija redzējis, nozīmētu, lūk, vīri, kas bija sūtīti no Kornēlija, bija izjautājuši par Sīmaņa namu un stāvēja vārtu priekšā,

10.en: 18 And called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.
10.lv: 18 Un aicināja un prasīja, vai Sīmanis, kuram tika dots pavārds Pēteris, bija tur apmeties.

10.en: 19 While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
10.lv:
19

Kamēr Pēteris domāja par redzējumu, tas Gars viņam sacīja, Lūk, trīs vīri tevi meklē.

10.en: 20 Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.
10.lv: 20 Tāpēc celies un kāp zemē, un ej ar tiem, neko nešaubīdamies: jo es tos esmu sūtījis.

10.en: 21 Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come?
10.lv: 21 Tad Pēteris nokāpa zemē pie vīriem, kas bija sūtīti pie viņa no Kornēlija; un sacīja, Lūk, es esmu tas, kuru jūs meklējat: kāds ir iemesls, kādēļ jūs esat nākuši?

10.en: 22 And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.
10.lv: 22 Un tie sacīja, Centurions Kornēlijs, taisns vīrs un kāds, kas bīstas Dievu, un ar labu liecību visas jūdu tautas vidū, tika no Dieva brīdināts caur svētu eņģeli sūtīt pēc tevis uz savu namu un dzirdēt tavus vārdus.

10.en: 23 Then called he them in, and lodged them. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
10.lv: 23 Tad viņš tos aicināja iekšā un tos izmitināja. Un nākamajā dienā Pēteris ar tiem gāja prom, un kādi brāļi no Jopas viņu pavadīja.

10.en: 24 And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.
10.lv: 24 Un nākamajā dienā tie iegāja Cēzarejā. Un Kornēlijs tos gaidīja un bija aicinājis kopā savus radus un tuvus draugus.

10.en: 25 And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
10.lv: 25 Un Pēterim ienākot, Kornēlijs viņu satika un krita zemē pie viņa kājām, un viņu godināja.

10.en: 26 But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.
10.lv: 26 Bet Pēteris viņu uzcēla sacīdams, Nostājies; es pats arī esmu cilvēks.

10.en: 27 And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.
10.lv: 27 Un viņam ar to sarunājoties, viņš iegāja iekšā un atrada daudzus, kas bija nākuši kopā.

10.en: 28 And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
10.lv: 28 Un viņš tiem sacīja, Jūs zināt, kā tas ir nelikumīgi cilvēkam, kas ir jūds, biedroties vai nākt pie kāda no citas tautas; bet Dievs man rādīja, lai es nesauktu kādu cilvēku par parastu vai nešķīstu.

10.en: 29 Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?
10.lv: 29 Tāpēc es nācu pie jums bez pretīrunāšanas, tiklīdz pēc manis tika sūtīts: tāpēc es prasu kādā nolūkā jūs pēc manis esat sūtījuši?

10.en: 30 And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
10.lv: 30 Un Kornēlijs sacīja, Pirms četrām dienām es gavēju līdz šai stundai; un devītajā stundā es lūdzu savā namā, un, lūk, vīrs stāvēja manā priekšā spožās drēbēs,

10.en: 31 And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
10.lv: 31 Un sacīja, Kornēlij, tava lūgšana ir dzirdēta, un tavas žēlastības dāvanas ir tikušas pieminētas Dieva skatienā.

10.en: 32 Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of one Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.
10.lv: 32 Tāpēc sūti uz Jopu un aicini šurp Sīmani, kura pavārds ir Pēteris; viņš ir apmeties kāda Sīmaņa, ādmiņa, namā pie jūrmalas: kurš, kad viņš nāk, runās uz tevi.

10.en: 33 Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.
10.lv: 33 Tāpēc es uzreiz sūtīju pie tevis; un tu esi labi darījis, ka tu esi nācis. Tāpēc nu, mēs visi esam šeit klāt Dieva priekšā, dzirdēt visu to, kas tev ir pavēlēts no Dieva.

10.en: 34 Then Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:
10.lv:
34

Tad Pēteris atvēra savu muti un sacīja, Tik tiešām es nomanu, ka Dievs nav personu cienītājs:

10.en: 35 But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.
10.lv: 35 Bet ikvienā tautā tas, kas viņu bīstas un strādā taisnību, tiek no viņa pieņemts.

10.en: 36 The word which God sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)
10.lv: 36 Vārdu, ko Dievs sūtīja Israēla bērniem, sludinādams mieru caur Jēzu Kristu: (viņš ir visu Kungs:)

10.en: 37 That word, I say, ye know, which was published throughout all Judaea, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;
10.lv: 37 To vārdu, es saku, jūs zināt, kas tika pavēstīts pa visu Jūdeju un sākot no Galilejas pēc kristības, ko Jānis sludināja;

10.en: 38 How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.
10.lv: 38 Kā Dievs Jēzu no Nācaretes svaidīja ar Svēto Garu un ar spēku: kurš gāja apkārt, darīdams labu un dziedinādams visus tos, kas bija velna apspiesti; jo Dievs bija ar viņu.

10.en: 39 And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:
10.lv: 39 Un mēs esam visa tā liecinieki, ko viņš darīja gan jūdu zemē, gan Jeruzālemē; kuru tie nokāva un pakāra pie koka:

10.en: 40 Him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;
10.lv: 40 Viņu Dievs uzcēla trešajā dienā un viņu parādīja atklāti;

10.en: 41 Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, even to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.
10.lv: 41 Ne visiem ļaudīm, bet lieciniekiem, iepriekš izraudzītiem no Dieva, proti, mums, kas ēdām un dzērām ar viņu pēc tam, kad viņš uzcēlās no mirušajiem.

10.en: 42And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God to be the Judge of quick and dead.
10.lv: 42 Un viņš mums pavēlēja sludināt ļaudīm un apliecināt, ka tas ir viņš, kas bija iecelts no Dieva būt par dzīvo un mirušo Tiesnesi.

10.en: 43To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.
10.lv: 43 Viņam visi pravieši dod liecību, ka caur viņa vārdu kurš vien tic uz viņu, saņems grēku atlaišanu.

10.en: 44While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.
10.lv:
44

Kamēr Pēteris vēl runāja šos vārdus, Svētais Gars krita uz tiem, kas dzirdēja vārdu.

10.en: 45 And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.
10.lv: 45 Un tie no apgraizīšanas, kas ticēja, bija izbrīnīti, cik vien nāca ar Pēteri, tāpēc ka uz pagāniem arī tika izlieta Svētā Gara dāvana.

10.en: 46 For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
10.lv: 46 Jo tie dzirdēja tos runājam ar mēlēm un paaugstinām Dievu. Tad Pēteris atbildēja,

10.en: 47 Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?
10.lv: 47 Vai kāds var aizliegt ūdeni, lai šie netiktu kristīti, kas ir saņēmuši Svēto Garu kā arī mēs?

10.en: 48 And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
10.lv: 48 Un viņš pavēlēja tiem tikt kristītiem tā Kunga vārdā. Tad tie lūdza viņu uzkavēties kādas dienas.

11.en: 1And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
11.lv: 1 Un apustuļi un brāļi, kas bija Jūdejā, dzirdēja, ka pagāni arī bija uzņēmuši Dieva vārdu.

11.en: 2 And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,
11.lv: 2 Un, kad Pēteris bija nācis uz Jeruzālemi, tie, kas bija no apgraizīšanas, strīdējās ar viņu

11.en: 3 Saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.
11.lv: 3 Sacīdami, Tu iegāji pie neapgraizītajiem un ēdi ar tiem.

11.en: 4 But Peter rehearsed the matter from the beginning, and expounded it by order unto them, saying,
11.lv: 4 Bet Pēteris uzskaitīja lietu no iesākuma un to tiem izskaidroja pēc kārtas sacīdams,

11.en: 5 I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:
11.lv: 5 Es biju Jopas pilsētā lūgdams: un transā es redzēju redzējumu, Kāds trauks nolaidās, it kā liels palags, nolaists no debess aiz četriem stūriem; un tas nāca līdz pat pie manis:

11.en: 6 Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
11.lv: 6 Uz kura, kad es cieši paskatījos, es ņēmu vērā un redzēju četrkājainus zemes zvērus un savvaļas zvērus, un rāpuļus, un gaisa putnus.

11.en: 7 And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter; slay and eat.
11.lv: 7 Un es dzirdēju balsi man sakām, Celies, Pēteri; kauj un ēd.

11.en: 8 But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.
11.lv: 8 Bet es sacīju, Ne tā, Kungs: jo nekas parasts vai nešķīsts nevienā brīdī nav ienācis manā mutē.

11.en: 9 But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.
11.lv: 9 Bet balss man atkal atbildēja no debess, Ko Dievs ir šķīstījis, to nesauc par parastu.

11.en: 10 And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.
11.lv: 10 Un šis tika darīts trīs reizes: un viss atkal tika uzvilkts debesī.

11.en: 11 And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.
11.lv: 11 Un, lūk, uzreiz bija trīs vīri jau nākuši uz namu, kur es biju, sūtīti no Cēzarejas pie manis.

11.en: 12 And the Spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house:
11.lv: 12 Un tas Gars man vēlēja iet ar tiem, neko nešauboties. Turklāt šie seši brāļi mani pavadīja, un mēs iegājām tā vīra namā:

11.en: 13 And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;
11.lv: 13 Un viņš mums pavēstīja, kā viņš bija redzējis eņģeli savā namā, kas stāvēja un viņam sacīja, Sūti vīrus uz Jopu un aicini Sīmani, kura pavārds ir Pēteris;

11.en: 14 Who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.
11.lv: 14 Kurš tev stāstīs vārdus, ar ko tu un viss tavs nams tiksiet glābti.

11.en: 15 And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.
11.lv: 15 Un man iesākot runāt, Svētais Gars krita uz tiem, kā uz mums iesākumā.

11.en: 16 Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.
11.lv: 16 Tad es atcerējos tā Kunga vārdu, kā viņš sacīja, Jānis patiesi kristīja ar ūdeni; bet jūs tiksiet kristīti ar Svēto Garu.

11.en: 17 Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as he did unto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?
11.lv: 17 Tā kā tad Dievs tiem deva tādu pašu dāvanu kā mums, kas ticējām uz Kungu Jēzu Kristu; kas es biju, lai es stāvētu pretī Dievam?

11.en: 18 When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.
11.lv: 18 Kad tie šo dzirdēja, tie cieta klusu un pagodināja Dievu sacīdami, Tad Dievs arī pagāniem dāvājis nožēlu uz dzīvību.

11.en: 19 Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.
11.lv:
19

Tad nu tie, kas bija izkaisīti ar vajāšanu, kas cēlās ap Stefanu, ceļoja līdz pat Feniķijai un Kiprai, un Antiohijai, nesludinādami vārdu nevienam, kā tikai jūdiem.

11.en: 20 And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.
11.lv: 20 Un daži no tiem bija vīri no Kipras un Kirēnes, kuri, kad tie bija nākuši uz Antiohiju, runāja uz grieķiem, sludinādami Kungu Jēzu.

11.en: 21 And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.
11.lv: 21 Un tā Kunga roka bija ar tiem: un liels skaits ticēja un griezās pie tā Kunga.

11.en: 22 Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.
11.lv:
22

Tad vēstis par to nāca draudzes ausīs, kas bija Jeruzālemē: un tie izsūtīja Barnabu, lai viņš ietu līdz pat Antiohijai.

11.en: 23 Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.
11.lv: 23 Kurš, kad viņš nāca un bija redzējis Dieva žēlastību, līksmojās un pamudināja tos visus, lai ar sirds nodomu tie pieķertos tam Kungam.

11.en: 24 For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.
11.lv: 24 Jo viņš bija labs vīrs un pilns Svētā Gara un ticības: un daudz ļaužu tika pievienoti tam Kungam.

11.en: 25 Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:
11.lv: 25 Tad Barnaba aizgāja uz Tarsu, lai meklētu Saulu:

11.en:
26 And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people. And the disciples were called Christians first in 
Antioch.
11.lv: 26 Un, kad viņš to bija atradis, viņš to veda uz Antiohiju. Un notika, ka veselu gadu tie sapulcējās ar draudzi un mācīja daudz ļaužu. Un mācekļi vispirms Antiohijā tika saukti par kristiešiem.

11.en: 27 And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
11.lv:
27

Un šajās dienās nāca pravieši no Jeruzālemes uz Antiohiju.

11.en: 28 And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the Spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.
11.lv: 28 Un nostājās viens no tiem, saukts Agabs, un apzīmēja caur to Garu, ka pa visu pasauli būs liels bads: kas notika Klaudija Cēzara dienās.

11.en: 29 Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judaea:
11.lv: 29 Tad mācekļi, ikviens pēc savas spējas, apņēmās sūtīt atvieglojumu brāļiem, kas mājoja Jūdejā:

11.en: 30 Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
11.lv: 30 Ko tie arī darīja un to sūtīja vecajiem caur Barnabas un Saula rokām.

12.en: 1 Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to vex certain of the church.
12.lv: 1 Tad nu ap to laiku ķēniņš Hērods izstiepa savas rokas, lai nogurdinātu kādus no draudzes.

12.en: 2 And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
12.lv: 2 Un viņš nogalināja ar zobenu Jēkabu, Jāņa brāli.

12.en: 3 And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)
12.lv: 3 Un tāpēc ka viņš redzēja, [ka] tas patika jūdiem, viņš turpināja tālāk, lai saņemtu arī Pēteri. (Tad bija neraudzētās maizes dienas.)

12.en: 4 And when he had apprehended him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.
12.lv: 4 Un, kad viņš to bija aizturējis, viņš to ielika cietumā un nodeva četriem karavīru četriniekiem viņu sargāt; paredzēdams pēc Lieldienām viņu izvest ļaudīm.

12.en: 5 Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.
12.lv: 5 Tāpēc Pēteris tika turēts cietumā: bet no draudzes bez mitēšanās tika veikta lūgšana Dievam par viņu.

12.en: 6 And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.
12.lv: 6 Un, kad Hērods grasījās viņu izvest, tajā naktī Pēteris gulēja starp diviem karavīriem, saistīts ar divām ķēdēm: un sargi durvju priekšā sargāja cietumu.

12.en: 7 And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon him, and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly. And his chains fell off from his hands.
12.lv: 7 Un, lūk, tā Kunga eņģelis nāca pār viņu, un gaisma spīdēja cietumā: un viņš piesita Pēterim pie sāna un viņu uzcēla sacīdams, Uzcelies ātri. Un viņa ķēdes nokrita no viņa rokām.

12.en: 8 And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And so he did. And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.
12.lv: 8 Un eņģelis viņam sacīja, Apjozies un sasien savas sandales. Un tā viņš darīja. Un viņš tam sacīja, Apmet savu apģērbu sev apkārt un seko man.

12.en: 9 And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.
12.lv: 9 Un viņš izgāja ārā un viņam sekoja; un nezināja, ka tas bija patiess, ko eņģelis darīja; bet domāja, ka viņš redzēja redzējumu.

12.en: 10 When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.
12.lv: 10 Kad tie bija garām pirmajai un otrajai sardzei, tie nāca pie dzelzs vārtiem, kas veda uz pilsētu; kas tiem atvērās paši no sevis: un tie izgāja ārā un gāja caur vienu ielu; un tūlīt eņģelis no viņa aizgāja.

12.en: 11 And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews.
12.lv: 11 Un, kad Pēteris bija nācis pie saprašanas, viņš sacīja, Nu es droši zinu, ka tas Kungs ir sūtījis savu eņģeli un ir mani izpestījis no Hēroda rokas, un no visām jūdu ļaužu gaidām.

12.en: 12 And when he had considered the thing, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.
12.lv: 12 Un, kad viņš šo bija ņēmis vērā, viņš nāca pie Marijas, Jāņa, kura pavārds bija Marks, mātes, nama; kur daudzi bija sapulcējušies kopā lūgdami.

12.en: 13 And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.
12.lv: 13 Un Pēterim klauvējot pie vārtu durvīm, meitene nāca uzklausīt, saukta Roda.

12.en: 14 And when she knew Peter's voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.
12.lv: 14 Un, kad viņa pazina Pētera balsi, viņa neatvēra vārtus aiz līksmības, bet skrēja iekšā un stāstīja, kā Pēteris stāvēja vārtu priekšā.

12.en: 15 And they said unto her, Thou art mad. But she constantly affirmed that it was even so. Then said they, It is his angel.
12.lv: 15 Un tie viņai sacīja, Tu esi traka. Bet viņa nemitīgi apgalvoja, ka tas tieši tā bija. Tad tie sacīja, Tas ir viņa eņģelis.

12.en: 16 But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened the door, and saw him, they were astonished.
12.lv: 16 Bet Pēteris turpināja klauvēt: un, kad tie bija atvēruši durvis un viņu ieraudzīja, tie bija izbrīnīti.

12.en: 17 But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren. And he departed, and went into another place.
12.lv: 17 Bet viņš, mādams tiem ar roku ciest klusu, tiem paziņoja, kā tas Kungs viņu bija izvedis no cietuma. Un viņš sacīja, Ejiet šo pavēstīt Jēkabam un brāļiem. Un viņš aizgāja un gāja uz citu vietu.

12.en: 18 Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.
12.lv: 18 Tad nu tiklīdz bija diena, bija ne maza kņada starp karavīriem par to, kas bija noticis ar Pēteri.

12.en: 19 And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea, and there abode.
12.lv: 19 Un, kad Hērods bija meklējis pēc viņa un viņu neatrada, viņš nopratināja sargus un pavēlēja, lai tie tiktu nonāvēti. Un viņš nogāja no Jūdejas uz Cēzareju un tur palika.

12.en: 20 And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king's chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king's country.
12.lv:
20

Un Hērods bija ļoti neapmierināts ar tiem no Tiras un Sidonas: bet tie nāca saskaņoti pie viņa, un Blastu, ķēniņa kambarkungu, darījuši par savu draugu, lūdza mieru; tāpēc ka viņu zeme tika barota no ķēniņa zemes.

12.en: 21 And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.
12.lv: 21 Un noteiktā dienā Hērods, ietērpies karaliskā ietērpā, sēdēja uz sava troņa, un tiem teica svinīgu runu.

12.en: 22 And the people gave a shout, saying, It is the voice of a god, and not of a man.
12.lv: 22 Un ļaudis izsaucās sacīdami, Tā ir dieva balss un ne cilvēka.

12.en: 23 And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
12.lv: 23 Un uzreiz tā Kunga eņģelis viņu sita, tāpēc ka viņš nedeva Dievam godību: un viņš tika ēsts no tārpiem un atdeva garu.

12.en: 24 But the word of God grew and multiplied.
12.lv:
24

Bet Dieva vārds auga un vairojās.

12.en: 25 And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
12.lv: 25 Un Barnabas un Sauls atgriezās no Jeruzālemes, kad tie bija piepildījuši savu kalpošanu, un ņēma sev līdzi Jāni, kura pavārds bija Marks.

13.en:
1 Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, 
and Saul.
13.lv: 1 Tad nu draudzē, kas bija Antiohijā, bija kādi pravieši un skolotāji; kā Barnaba un Simeons, kas tika saukts Nigers, un Lucijs no Kirēnes, un Manaēns, kas bija uzaudzināts kopā ar tetrarhu Hērodu, un Sauls.

13.en: 2 As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.
13.lv: 2 Tiem kalpojot tam Kungam un gavējot, Svētais Gars sacīja, Nošķiriet man Barnabu un Saulu darbam, uz ko es tos esmu aicinājis.

13.en: 3 And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
13.lv: 3 Un, kad tie bija gavējuši un lūguši, un tiem uzlikuši savas rokas, tie tos sūtīja prom.

13.en: 4 So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
13.lv:
4

Tā viņi, Svētā Gara izsūtīti, aizgāja uz Seleiķiju; un no turienes tie burāja uz Kipru.

13.en: 5 And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to their minister.
13.lv: 5 Un, kad tie bija Salaminā, tie jūdu sinagogās sludināja Dieva vārdu: un tiem arī Jānis bija par viņu kalpotāju.

13.en: 6 And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Barjesus:
13.lv: 6 Un, kad tie bija gājuši caur Pafas salu, tie atrada kādu burvi, nepatiesu pravieti, jūdu, kura vārds bija Barjēzus:

13.en: 7 Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.
13.lv: 7 Kas bija ar zemes prokonsulu Sergiju Paulu, prātīgu vīru; kurš aicināja Barnabu un Saulu, un vēlējās dzirdēt Dieva vārdu.

13.en: 8 But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.
13.lv: 8 Bet burvis Elimas (jo tāds ir viņa vārds tulkojumā) stāvēja tiem pretī, meklēdams prokonsulu nogriezt no ticības.

13.en: 9 Then Saul, (who also is called Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,
13.lv: 9 Tad Sauls, (kas arī tiek saukts Pāvils,) pildīts ar Svēto Garu, stingri palūkojās uz viņu,

13.en: 10 And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, thou child of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
13.lv: 10 Un sacīja, Ak, visas blēdības un visa ļaunuma pilnais, tu, velna bērns, tu, visas taisnības ienaidniek, vai tu nemitēsies samaitāt tā Kunga pareizos ceļus?

13.en: 11 And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
13.lv: 11 Un nu, lūk, tā Kunga roka ir uz tevi, un tu būsi akls, uz laiku neredzēdams sauli. Un uzreiz uz viņu krita migla un tumsa; un viņš gāja apkārt, meklēdams kādu viņu vest pie rokas.

13.en: 12 Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
13.lv: 12 Tad prokonsuls, kad viņš redzēja, kas bija darīts, ticēja, būdams izbrīnīts par tā Kunga mācību.

13.en: 13 Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.
13.lv: 13 Kad nu Pāvils un viņa grupa atlaidās no Pafas, tie nāca uz Pergu Pamfīlijā: un Jānis, aiziedams no tiem, atgriezās uz Jeruzālemi.

13.en: 14 But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.
13.lv:
14

Bet, kad tie aizgāja no Pergas, tie nāca uz Antiohiju Pisīdijā un sabata dienā iegāja sinagogā, un apsēdās.

13.en: 15 And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, Ye men and brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.
13.lv: 15 Un pēc likuma un praviešu lasīšanas sinagogas valdnieki sūtīja pie tiem sacīdami, Jūs, vīri un brāļi, ja jums ir kāds pamudinājuma vārds priekš ļaudīm, sakiet nu.

13.en: 16 Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.
13.lv: 16 Tad Pāvils piecēlās un mādams ar savu roku sacīja, Israēla vīri un jūs, kas bīstaties Dievu, ieklausieties.

13.en: 17 The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.
13.lv: 17 Šo Israēla ļaužu Dievs izraudzījās mūsu tēvus un paaugstināja ļaudis, kad tie mājoja kā svešinieki Ēģiptes zemē, un ar augstu elkoni tos izveda no tās ārā.

13.en: 18 And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.
13.lv: 18 Un ap četrdesmit gadiem viņš pacieta to paražas tuksnesī.

13.en: 19 And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.
13.lv: 19 Un, kad viņš bija iznīcinājis septiņas tautas Kānāna zemē, viņš to zemi viņiem sadalīja caur mesliem.

13.en: 20 And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
13.lv: 20 Un pēc tam viņš tiem deva tiesnešus apmēram četrsimt piecdesmit gadus līdz pravietim Samuēlam.

13.en: 21 And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.
13.lv: 21 Un pēcāk tie lūdza ķēniņu: un Dievs tiem deva Saulu, Kisa dēlu, vīru no Benjamīna cilts, četrdesmit gadus.

13.en: 22 And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.
13.lv: 22 Un, kad viņš to bija nocēlis, viņš tiem uzcēla Dāvidu par viņu ķēniņu; kuram viņš arī deva liecību un sacīja, Es esmu atradis Dāvidu, Isaja dēlu, vīru pēc savas paša sirds, kas piepildīs visu manu gribu.

13.en: 23 Of this man's seed hath God according to his promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:
13.lv: 23 No šī vīra sēklas Dievs atbilstoši savam apsolījumam ir Israēlam uzcēlis Glābēju — Jēzu:

13.en: 24 When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
13.lv: 24 Kad Jānis vispirms pirms viņa nākšanas bija sludinājis nožēlas kristību visiem Israēla ļaudīm.

13.en: 25 And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am? I am not he. But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose.
13.lv: 25 Un Jānim piepildot savu kursu, viņš sacīja, Ko jūs domājat, kas es esmu? es neesmu viņš. Bet, lūk, pēc manis nāk viens, kura kurpes no viņa kājām es neesmu cienīgs atraisīt.

13.en: 26 Men and brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.
13.lv: 26 Vīri un brāļi, bērni no Ābrahāma cilts un kurš vien starp jums bīstas Dievu, jums šīs glābšanas vārds ir sūtīts.

13.en: 27 For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled them in condemning him.
13.lv: 27 Jo tie, kas mājoja Jeruzālemē un to valdnieki, tāpēc ka tie viņu nepazina, ne arī praviešu balsis, kas tiek lasītas ik sabata dienu, tās tie ir piepildījuši, viņu notiesādami.

13.en: 28 And though they found no cause of death in him, yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.
13.lv: 28 Un kaut arī tie viņā neatrada nāves iemeslu, tomēr tie lūdza Pilātu, lai viņš tiktu nokauts.

13.en: 29 And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a sepulchre.
13.lv: 29 Un, kad tie bija piepildījuši visu, kas par viņu bija rakstīts, tie viņu noņēma zemē no koka un viņu guldīja kapa vietā.

13.en: 30 But God raised him from the dead:
13.lv: 30 Bet Dievs viņu uzcēla no mirušajiem:

13.en: 31 And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.
13.lv: 31 Un viņš tika redzēts daudzas dienas no tiem, kas ar viņu devās no Galilejas uz Jeruzālemi, kuri ir viņa liecinieki ļaudīm.

13.en: 32 And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,
13.lv: 32 Un mēs jums paziņojam līksmas vēstis, kā apsolījumu, kas tika dots tēviem,

13.en: 33 God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.
13.lv: 33 Dievs to pašu ir piepildījis mums, viņu bērniem, tajā, ka viņš Jēzu uzcēla augšā; kā arī ir rakstīts otrajā psalmā, Tu esi mans Dēls, šodien es tevi esmu dzemdinājis.

13.en: 34 And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.
13.lv: 34 Un attiecībā uz to, ka viņš to uzcēla no mirušajiem, nu vairs neatgriezties uz iznīcību, viņš sacīja šādā veidā, Es jums došu drošās Dāvida žēlsirdības.

13.en: 35 Wherefore he saith also in another psalm, Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
13.lv: 35 Tādēļ viņš saka arī citā psalmā, Tu neļausi savam Svētajam redzēt iznīcību.

13.en: 36 For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:
13.lv: 36 Jo Dāvids, pēc tam, kad viņš bija kalpojis savai paša paaudzei caur Dieva gribu, aizmiga un tika noguldīts pie saviem tēviem, un redzēja iznīcību:

13.en: 37 But he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.
13.lv: 37 Bet tas, kuru Dievs uzcēla augšā, neredzēja iznīcību.

13.en: 38 Be it known unto you therefore, men and brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:
13.lv:
38

Tāpēc lai jums ir zināms, vīri un brāļi, ka caur šo cilvēku jums tiek sludināta grēku piedošana:

13.en: 39 And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.
13.lv: 39 Un caur viņu visi, kas tic, tiek taisnoti no visa, no kā jūs nevarējāt tikt taisnoti caur Mozus likumu.

13.en: 40 Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;
13.lv: 40 Tāpēc sargieties, lai uz jums nenāk tas, par ko ir runāts praviešos;

13.en: 41 Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.
13.lv: 41 Uzlūkojiet jūs, nicinātāji, un brīnieties un ejiet bojā: jo es strādāju darbu jūs dienās, darbu, kam jūs nekādā veidā neticēsiet, kaut arī kāds jums to paziņos.

13.en: 42 And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.
13.lv: 42 Un, kad jūdi bija izgājuši no sinagogas, pagāni lūdzās, lai šie vārdi tiem varētu tikt sludināti nākamajā sabatā.

13.en: 43 Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
13.lv: 43 Kad nu sanāksme bija izjukusi, daudzi no jūdiem un reliģiskiem proselītiem sekoja Pāvilam un Barnabam: kuri, uz tiem runādami, pārliecināja tos palikt Dieva žēlastībā.

13.en: 44 And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.
13.lv:
44

Un nākamajā sabata dienā gandrīz visa pilsēta nāca kopā dzirdēt Dieva vārdu.

13.en: 45 But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.
13.lv: 45 Bet, kad jūdi redzēja pūļus, tie tika pildīti ar skaudību un runāja pretī tam, ko Pāvils runāja, iebilzdami un zaimodami.

13.en:
46 Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to 
the Gentiles.
13.lv: 46 Tad Pāvils un Barnaba kļuva droši un sacīja, Bija nepieciešams, ka Dieva vārds papriekš tiktu runāts uz jums: bet tā kā jūs to atmetat un sevi tiesājat par mūžīgai dzīvībai necienīgiem, rau, mēs griežamies pie pagāniem.

13.en: 47 For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.
13.lv: 47 Jo tā tas Kungs mums ir pavēlējis sacīdams, Es tevi esmu licis par gaismu pagāniem, lai tu būtu par glābšanu līdz zemes galiem.

13.en: 48 And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
13.lv: 48 Un, kad pagāni to dzirdēja, tie līksmojās un pagodināja tā Kunga vārdu: un cik vien bija noteikti uz mūžīgo dzīvību, ticēja.

13.en: 49 And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.
13.lv: 49 Un tā Kunga vārds tika pavēstīts pa visu apgabalu.

13.en: 50 But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.
13.lv: 50 Bet jūdi mudināja dievticīgas un godājamas sievietes un pilsētas galvenos, un cēla vajāšanu pret Pāvilu un Barnabu, un tos izmeta ārā no savas apkārtnes.

13.en: 51 But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
13.lv: 51 Bet tie nokratīja pīšļus no savām kājām pret tiem un nāca uz Ikoniju.

13.en: 52 And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.
13.lv: 52 Un mācekļi tika pildīti ar prieku un ar Svēto Garu.

14.en: 1And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.
14.lv: 1 Un notika Ikonijā, ka tie abi kopā iegāja jūdu sinagogā un tā runāja, ka liels pūlis, gan no jūdiem, gan arī no grieķiem, ticēja.

14.en: 2 But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.
14.lv: 2 Bet neticīgie jūdi mudināja pagānus un saniknoja viņu prātus pret brāļiem.

14.en: 3 Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
14.lv: 3 Tāpēc ilgu laiku tie palika runādami drošsirdīgi tai Kungā, kas deva liecību savas žēlastības vārdam un dāvāja zīmēm un brīnumiem tikt darītiem caur viņu rokām.

14.en: 4 But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
14.lv: 4 Bet pūlis no pilsētas bija sašķelts: un daļa turējās pie jūdiem un daļa pie apustuļiem.

14.en: 5 And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use them despitefully, and to stone them,
14.lv: 5 Un, kad tika veikts uzbrukums gan no pagāniem, gan arī no jūdiem ar viņu valdniekiem, lai ar tiem izrīkotos ļaunprātīgi un tos nomētātu ar akmeņiem,

14.en: 6 They were ware of it, and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:
14.lv: 6 Tie to uzzināja un bēga uz Listru un Derbi, Likonijas pilsētām un uz apgabalu, kas ir apkārt:

14.en: 7 And there they preached the gospel.
14.lv: 7 Un tur tie sludināja evaņģēliju.

14.en: 8 And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother's womb, who never had walked:
14.lv:
8

Un Listrā sēdēja kāds vīrs, nespēcīgs savās kājās, būdams kroplis no savas mātes miesām, kurš nekad nebija staigājis:

14.en: 9 The same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
14.lv: 9 Tas dzirdēja Pāvilu runājam: kurš stingri viņu uzlūkodams un nomanīdams, ka viņam bija ticība tikt dziedinātam,

14.en: 10 Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.
14.lv: 10 Sacīja ar skaļu balsi, Stāvi taisni uz savām kājām. Un viņš lēkāja un staigāja.

14.en: 11 And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
14.lv: 11 Un, kad ļaudis redzēja, ko Pāvils bija darījis, tie pacēla savas balsis, sacīdami Liakonijas runā, Dievi ir nonākuši pie mums cilvēku līdzībā.

14.en: 12 And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.
14.lv: 12 Un tie Barnabu sauca par Jupiteru; un Pāvilu par Merkūriju, tāpēc ka viņš bija galvenais runātājs.

14.en: 13 Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.
14.lv: 13 Tad Jupitera priesteris, kas bija viņu pilsētas priekšā, atveda vēršus un virtenes pie vārtiem, un ar ļaudīm grasījās upurēt.

14.en: 14 Which when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of, they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,
14.lv: 14 Kad apustuļi Barnaba un Sauls par to dzirdēja, tie saplēsa savas drēbes un skrēja starp ļaudīm kliegdami

14.en: 15 And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:
14.lv: 15 Un sacīdami, Vīri, kāpēc jūs šo darāt? Mēs arī esam cilvēki ar tādām pašām kaislībām kā jums, un jums sludinām, lai jūs grieztos no šīm niecībām pie dzīvā Dieva, kas taisīja debesi un zemi, un jūru, un visu, kas tajās ir:

14.en: 16 Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.
14.lv: 16 Kurš pagājušos laikos tautām ļāva staigāt pašām savos ceļos.

14.en: 17 Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.
14.lv: 17 Neraugoties uz to, viņš neatstāja sevi bez liecības tajā, ka viņš darīja labu un mums deva lietu no debess un auglīgus laikus, pildīdams mūsu sirdis ar ēdienu un līksmību.

14.en: 18 And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.
14.lv: 18 Un ar šiem vārdiem tie tik tikko apvaldīja ļaudis, lai tie viņiem neupurētu.

14.en: 19 And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew him out of the city, supposing he had been dead.
14.lv:
19

Un no Antiohijas uz Ikoniju nāca kādi jūdi, kas pārliecināja ļaudis un, nomētājuši Pāvilu ar akmeņiem, izvilka viņu no pilsētas, pieņemdami, [ka] viņš ir miris.

14.en: 20 Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
14.lv: 20 Taču, mācekļiem stāvot apkārt ap viņu, viņš piecēlās un nāca pilsētā: un nākamajā dienā viņš aizgāja ar Barnabu uz Derbi.

14.en: 21 And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and to Iconium, and Antioch,
14.lv: 21 Un, kad tie bija sludinājuši evaņģēliju tai pilsētai un daudzus mācījuši, tie atgriezās atpakaļ uz Listru un uz Ikoniju, un Antiohiju,

14.en: 22 Confirming the souls of the disciples, and exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.
14.lv: 22 Stiprinādami mācekļu dvēseles un pamudinādami tos palikt ticībā, un ka mums caur daudz bēdām jāieiet Dieva valstībā.

14.en: 23 And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.
14.lv: 23 Un, kad tie bija tiem iecēluši vecajus ikvienā draudzē un bija lūguši ar gavēšanu, tie tos uzticēja tam Kungam, uz kuru tie ticēja.

14.en: 24 And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
14.lv: 24 Un pēc tam, [kad] tie bija gājuši caur Pisīdiju, tie nāca Pamfīlijā.

14.en: 25 And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:
14.lv: 25 Un, kad tie bija sludinājuši vārdu Pergā, tie nogāja uz Ataliju:

14.en: 26 And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.
14.lv: 26 Un no turienes burāja uz Antiohiju, no kurienes tie bija ieteikti Dieva žēlastībai darbam, ko tie piepildīja.

14.en: 27 And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
14.lv: 27 Un, kad tie bija nākuši un bija sapulcējuši kopā draudzi, tie uzskaitīja visu, ko Dievs ar tiem bija darījis un kā viņš bija atvēris ticības durvis pagāniem.

14.en: 28 And there they abode long time with the disciples.
14.lv: 28 Un tur tie palika ilgu laiku ar mācekļiem.

15.en: 1 And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren, and said, Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
15.lv: 1 Un kādi vīri, kas nonāca no Jūdejas, mācīja brāļus un sacīja, Ja vien jūs netiekat apgraizīti pēc Mozus ieražas, jūs nevarat tikt glābti.

15.en: 2 When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
15.lv: 2 Tāpēc, kad Pāvilam un Barnabam bija ne maza nevienprātība un diskusija ar tiem, tie nolēma, ka Pāvilam un Barnabam, un kādiem citiem no tiem jādodas uz Jeruzālemi pie apustuļiem un vecajiem par šo jautājumu.

15.en: 3 And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
15.lv: 3 Un pavadīti savā ceļā no draudzes, tie gāja caur Feniķiju un Samariju, paziņodami [par] pagānu atgriešanos: un tie izraisīja lielu prieku visiem brāļiem.

15.en: 4 And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and of the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.
15.lv: 4 Un, kad tie bija nākuši uz Jeruzālemi, tie tika uzņemti no draudzes un no apustuļiem, un vecajiem, un tie paziņoja visu to, ko Dievs ar tiem bija darījis.

15.en: 5 But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.
15.lv: 5 Bet kādi no farizeju sektas, kas ticēja, cēlās sacīdami, Ka bija vajadzīgs tos apgraizīt un tiem pavēlēt turēt Mozus likumu.

15.en: 6 And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.
15.lv:
6

Un apustuļi un vecaji nāca kopā ņemt vērā šo lietu.

15.en: 7 And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men and brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.
15.lv: 7 Un, kad bija daudz apspriešanās, Pēteris uzcēlās un tiem sacīja, Vīri un brāļi, jūs zināt, kā pirms laba laika Dievs izdarīja izvēli starp mums, ka pagāni caur manu muti dzirdētu evaņģēlija vārdu un ticētu.

15.en: 8 And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as he did unto us;
15.lv: 8 Un Dievs, kas pazīst sirdis, dod tiem liecību, dodams tiem Svēto Garu, gluži kā mums;

15.en: 9 And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
15.lv: 9 Un neliek atšķirību starp mums un tiem, šķīstīdams viņu sirdis caur ticību.

15.en: 10 Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
15.lv: 10 Tad nu tāpēc, kādēļ jūs kārdināt Dievu likt jūgu uz mācekļu kaklu, ko nedz mūsu tēvi, ne mēs spējām panest?

15.en: 11 But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.
15.lv: 11 Bet mēs ticam, ka caur Kunga Jēzus Kristus žēlastību mēs tiksim glābti, gluži kā tie.

15.en: 12 Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.
15.lv:
12

Tad viss pūlis klusēja un ieklausījās Barnabā un Pāvilā, [kas] paziņoja kādus brīnuma darbus un brīnumus Dievs bija strādājis starp pagāniem caur viņiem.

15.en: 13 And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men and brethren, hearken unto me:
15.lv:
13

Un pēc tam, [kad] tie cieta klusu, Jēkabs atbildēja sacīdams, Vīri un brāļi, uzklausiet mani:

15.en: 14 Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.
15.lv: 14 Simeons ir paziņojis kā Dievs iesākumā apmeklēja pagānus, ņemt no tiem ļaudis savam vārdam.

15.en: 15 And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,
15.lv: 15 Un šim piekrīt praviešu vārdi; kā ir rakstīts,

15.en: 16 After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up:
15.lv: 16 Pēc šī es atgriezīšos un atkal uzbūvēšu Dāvida mājokli, kas ir nogāzies; un atkal uzbūvēšu tā drupas, un es to uzstādīšu:

15.en: 17 That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.
15.lv: 17 Lai cilvēku atlikums varētu meklēt pēc tā Kunga, un visi pagāni, uz kuriem mans vārds tiek saukts, saka tas Kungs, kurš šo visu dara.

15.en: 18 Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.
15.lv: 18 Dievam ir zināmi visi viņa darbi no pasaules iesākuma.

15.en: 19 Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:
15.lv: 19 Tādēļ mans spriedums ir, ka mēs tos neiztrūcinām, kas no pagānu vidus ir griezušies pie Dieva:

15.en: 20 But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and from fornication, and from things strangled, and from blood.
15.lv: 20 Bet lai mēs tiem rakstām, lai tie atturētos no elku apgānīšanām un no netiklības, un no nožņaugtā, un no asinīm.

15.en: 21 For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.
15.lv: 21 Jo Mozum no seniem laikiem ikvienā pilsētā ir tie, kas viņu sludina, tiekot lasītam sinagogās ik sabata dienu.

15.en: 22 Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; namely, Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:
15.lv: 22 Tad tas patika apustuļiem un vecajiem ar visu draudzi sūtīt izraudzītus vīrus no viņu pašu grupas uz Antiohiju kopā ar Pāvilu un Barnabu; proti, Jūdu ar pavārdu Barsaba, un Sīlu, galvenos starp brāļiem:

15.en: 23 And they wrote letters by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:
15.lv: 23 Un tie rakstīja vēstules caur tiem pēc šī veida; Apustuļi un vecaji, un brāļi sūta sveicienu brāļiem, kas ir no pagāniem Antiohijā un Sīrijā, un Cilīcijā:

15.en: 24 Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, Ye must be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no such commandment:
15.lv: 24 Tā kā mēs esam dzirdējuši, ka kādi, kas izgāja no mums, ir jūs iztrūcinājuši ar vārdiem, sagraudami jūsu dvēseles sacīdami, Jums jātiek apgraizītiem un jātur likums: kuriem mēs nedevām šādu pavēli:

15.en: 25 It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
15.lv: 25 Mums šķita labi, sapulcējoties saskaņā, sūtīt izraudzītus vīrus pie jums ar mūsu mīļotajiem Barnabu un Pāvilu,

15.en: 26 Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
15.lv: 26 Vīriem, kas riskējuši ar savām dzīvībām mūsu Kunga Jēzus Kristus vārda dēļ.

15.en: 27 We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell you the same things by mouth.
15.lv: 27 Tāpēc mēs esam sūtījuši Jūdu un Sīlu, kuri arī jums stāstīs to pašu mutiski.

15.en: 28 For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;
15.lv: 28 Jo Svētajam Garam un mums šķita labi, nelikt uz jums lielāku nastu nekā šīs nepieciešamās lietas;

15.en: 29 That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.
15.lv: 29 Lai jūs atturaties no elkiem ziedotiem ēdieniem un no asinīm, un no nožņaugtā, un no netiklības: no kā, ja jūs sargāties, jūs darīsat labi. Ardievu.

15.en: 30 So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:
15.lv: 30 Tā, kad tie bija atlaisti, tie nāca uz Antiohiju: un, kad tie bija sapulcējuši kopā pūli, tie nodeva vēstuli:

15.en: 31 Which when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.
15.lv: 31 Kad tie bija to lasījuši, tie priecājās par iepriecinājumu.

15.en: 32 And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed them.
15.lv: 32 Un Jūda un Sīla, paši arī būdami pravieši, pamudināja brāļus ar daudz vārdiem un tos stiprināja.

15.en: 33 And after they had tarried there a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.
15.lv: 33 Un pēc tam, kad tie tur bija uzkavējušies laiku, tie tika atlaisti mierā no brāļiem pie apustuļiem.

15.en: 34 Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.
15.lv: 34 Neraugoties uz to, Sīlam patika tur vēl palikt.

15.en: 35 Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
15.lv: 35 Pāvils arī un Barnaba palika Antiohijā, mācīdami un sludinādami tā Kunga vārdu arī ar daudziem citiem.

15.en: 36 And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they do.
15.lv:
36

Un dažas dienas pēc tam Pāvils Barnabam sacīja, Iesim atkal un apmeklēsim mūsu brāļus ikvienā pilsētā, kur mēs esam sludinājuši tā Kunga vārdu, un redzēsim, kā tiem iet.

15.en: 37 And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.
15.lv: 37 Un Barnaba nosprieda ņemt viņiem līdzi Jāni, kura pavārds bija Marks.

15.en: 38 But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.
15.lv: 38 Bet Pāvils nedomāja, ka labi ņemt tiem līdzi to, kas aizgāja no tiem no Pamfīlijas un negāja ar tiem uz darbu.

15.en: 39 And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;
15.lv: 39 Un strīds bija tik ass starp tiem, ka tie aizgāja šķirti viens no otra: un tā Barnaba ņēma Marku un burāja uz Kipru;

15.en: 40 And Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.
15.lv: 40 Un Pāvils izraudzīja Sīlu un aizgāja, būdams ieteikts no brāļiem Dieva žēlastībai.

15.en: 41 And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.
15.lv: 41 Un viņš gāja caur Sīriju un Cilīciju, apstiprinādams draudzes.

16.en: 1Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father was a Greek:
16.lv: 1 Tad viņš nāca uz Derbi un Listru: un, lūk, tur bija kāds māceklis, saukts Timotejs, kādas sievietes dēls, kas bija jūdiete un ticēja; bet viņa tēvs bija grieķis:

16.en: 2Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.
16.lv: 2 Par kuru labi liecināja brāļi, kas bija Listrā un Ikonijā.

16.en: 3 Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.
16.lv: 3 Pāvils gribēja, [lai] tas izietu tālāk ar viņu; un ņēma un apgraizīja viņu jūdu dēļ, kas bija tajās vietās: jo tie visi zināja, ka viņa tēvs bija grieķis.

16.en: 4 And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem.
16.lv: 4 Un tiem ejot caur pilsētām, tie viņiem nodeva turēt lēmumus, kas bija noteikti no apustuļiem un vecajiem, kas bija Jeruzālemē.

16.en: 5 And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.
16.lv: 5 Un tā draudzes tika nostiprinātas ticībā un ikdienas pieauga skaitā.

16.en: 6 Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,
16.lv: 6 Kad nu tie bija izgājuši caur Friģiju un Galatijas apgabalu, un [tiem] no Svētā Gara tika liegts sludināt vārdu Āzijā,

16.en: 7 After they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.
16.lv: 7 Pēc tam, [kad] tie bija nākuši Misijā, tie mēģināja iet uz Bitīniju: bet tas Gars tiem neļāva.

16.en: 8 And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.
16.lv: 8 Un tie, ejot gar Misiju, nonāca Troā.

16.en: 9 And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.
16.lv: 9 Un Pāvilam naktī parādījās redzējums; Stāvēja vīrs no Maķedonijas un lūdza viņu sacīdams, Pārnāc uz Maķedoniju un palīdzi mums.

16.en: 10 And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.
16.lv: 10 Un pēc tam, [kad] viņš bija redzējis redzējumu, uzreiz mēs centāmies iet uz Maķedoniju, droši apzinādamies, ka tas Kungs mūs bija aicinājis, lai sludinātu viņiem evaņģēliju.

16.en: 11 Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the next day to Neapolis;
16.lv: 11 Tāpēc atlaizdamies no Troas, mēs nācām taisnā kursā uz Samotraķiju un nākamajā dienā uz Neapoli;

16.en: 12 And from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia, and a colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.
16.lv: 12 Un no turienes uz Filipiem, kas ir galvenā tās Maķedonijas daļas pilsēta, un kolonija: un mēs bijām tajā pilsētā palikdami kādas dienas.

16.en: 13 And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resorted thither.
16.lv: 13 Un sabatā mēs izgājām no pilsētas gar upes malu, kur bija pierasts veikt lūgšanas; un mēs apsēdāmies un runājām uz sievietēm, kas turp sanāca.

16.en: 14 And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.
16.lv:
14

Un kāda sieviete vārdā Lidija, purpura pārdevēja, no Tiatiras pilsētas, kas godināja Dievu, mūs klausījās: kuras sirdi tas Kungs atvēra, lai viņa ieklausītos tajā, ko Pāvils runāja.

16.en: 15 And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide there. And she constrained us.
16.lv: 15 Un, kad tika kristīta viņa un viņas saime, viņa lūdzās mūs sacīdama, Ja jūs esat tiesājuši mani esam uzticīgu tam Kungam, nāciet manā namā un tur palieciet. Un viņa mūs piespieda.

16.en: 16 And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:
16.lv:
16

Un notika, mums ejot lūgt, kāda meitene, apsēsta ar pareģošanas garu, mūs satika, kas saviem saimniekiem nesa lielu ieguvumu caur pareģošanu:

16.en: 17 The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.
16.lv: 17 Tā sekoja Pāvilam un mums, un sauca sacīdama, Šie cilvēki ir visaugstākā Dieva kalpi, kas mums rāda glābšanas ceļu.

16.en: 18 And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
16.lv: 18 Un šo viņa darīja daudzas dienas. Bet Pāvils, būdams noskumis, griezās un garam sacīja, Es tev pavēlu Jēzus Kristus vārdā iznākt no viņas. Un tas iznāca tajā pašā stundā.

16.en: 19 And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers,
16.lv:
19

Un, kad viņas saimnieki redzēja, ka viņu ieguvumu cerība bija aizgājusi, tie ķēra Pāvilu un Sīlu, un vilka tos uz tirgu pie valdniekiem,

16.en: 20 And brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,
16.lv: 20 Un tos veda pie maģistrātiem sacīdami, Šie vīri, būdami jūdi, ļoti iztrūcina mūsu pilsētu,

16.en: 21 And teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.
16.lv: 21 Un māca paražas, ko mums nav likumīgi saņemt, nedz ievērot, esot romiešiem.

16.en: 22 And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, and commanded to beat them.
16.lv: 22 Un pūlis cēlās kopā pret tiem: un maģistrāti noplēsa viņu drēbes un pavēlēja tos sist.

16.en: 23 And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:
16.lv: 23 Un, kad tie bija tiem uzlikuši daudz cirtienus, tie tos meta cietumā, piekodinādami cietuma uzraugu sargāt viņus droši:

16.en: 24 Who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.
16.lv: 24 Kas, saņemdams šādu pavēli, tos iegrūda iekšējā cietumā un nostiprināja viņu kājas siekstā.

16.en: 25 And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.
16.lv:
25

Un pusnaktī Pāvils un Sīlas lūdza un dziedāja slavas Dievam: un cietumnieki tos dzirdēja.

16.en: 26 And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one's bands were loosed.
16.lv: 26 Un pēkšņi bija liela zemestrīce, tā ka cietuma pamati tika purināti: un uzreiz visas durvis tika atvērtas un ikviena saites tika atraisītas.

16.en: 27 And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.
16.lv: 27 Un cietuma sargs pamozdamies no miega un redzēdams cietuma durvis atvērtas, viņš izvilka savu zobenu un grasījās sevi nogalināt, pieņemdams, ka cietumnieki ir aizbēguši.

16.en: 28 But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.
16.lv: 28 Bet Pāvils sauca ar skaļu balsi sacīdams, Nedari sev pāri: jo mēs visi esam šeit.

16.en: 29 Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas,
16.lv: 29 Tad viņš sauca pēc gaismas un iesteidzās, un nāca drebēdams un krita zemē Pāvila un Sīlas priekšā,

16.en: 30 And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
16.lv: 30 Un izveda tos ārā un sacīja, Vīri, kas man jādara, lai es tiktu glābts?

16.en: 31 And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
16.lv: 31 Un tie sacīja, Tici uz Kungu Jēzu Kristu, un tu tiksi glābts, un tavs nams.

16.en: 32 And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.
16.lv: 32 Un tie runāja uz viņu tā Kunga vārdu un uz visiem, kas bija viņa namā.

16.en: 33 And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.
16.lv: 33 Un viņš ņēma tos tajā pašā nakts stundā un nomazgāja viņu brūces; un tika kristīts, viņš un visi viņējie, nekavējoties.

16.en: 34 And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.
16.lv: 34 Un, kad viņš tos bija ievedis savā namā, viņš lika barību viņu priekšā un priecājās, ticēdams uz Dievu ar visu savu namu.

16.en: 35 And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.
16.lv: 35 Un, kad bija diena, maģistrāti sūtīja seržantus sacīdami, Palaidiet šos vīrus.

16.en: 36 And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.
16.lv: 36 Un cietuma sargs stāstīja šo vārdu Pāvilam, Maģistrāti ir sūtījuši jūs palaist: tad nu tāpēc aizejiet un ejiet mierā.

16.en: 37 But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.
16.lv: 37 Bet Pāvils tiem sacīja, Tie ir mūs, romiešus, situši atklāti nenotiesātus, un ir mūs metuši cietumā; un tagad tie mūs grūž ārā slepeni? nē, patiesi; bet lai tie nāk paši un mūs izved.

16.en: 38 And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.
16.lv: 38 Un seržanti stāstīja šos vārdus maģistrātiem: un tie bijās, kad tie dzirdēja, ka tie bija romieši.

16.en: 39 And they came and besought them, and brought them out, and desired them to depart out of the city.
16.lv: 39 Un tie nāca un tos lūdzās, un tos izveda ārā, un lūdza tiem iziet no pilsētas.

16.en: 40 And they went out of the prison, and entered into the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.
16.lv: 40 Un tie izgāja no cietuma un iegāja Lidijas namā: un, kad tie bija redzējuši brāļus, tie tos mierināja un aizgāja.

17.en: 1 Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the Jews:
17.lv: 1 Kad nu tie bija gājuši caur Amfiopoli un Apolloniju, tie nāca uz Tesaloniku, kur bija jūdu sinagoga:

17.en: 2 And Paul, as his manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures,
17.lv: 2 Un Pāvils, kā bija viņa ieraža, iegāja pie tiem un trīs sabata dienas sprieda ar tiem no rakstiem,

17.en: 3 Opening and alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, and risen again from the dead; and that this Jesus, whom I preach unto you, is Christ.
17.lv: 3 Atvērdams un apgalvodams, ka Kristum bija jācieš un jāceļas augšā no mirušajiem; un ka šis Jēzus, kuru es jums sludinu, ir Kristus.

17.en: 4 And some of them believed, and consorted with Paul and Silas; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and of the chief women not a few.
17.lv: 4 Un daži no tiem ticēja un piebiedrojās Pāvilam un Sīlam; un no dievticīgiem grieķiem liels pūlis, un no galvenajām sievietēm ne mazums.

17.en: 5 But the Jews which believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the city on an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
17.lv:
5

Bet jūdi, kas neticēja, skaudības kustināti, ņēma pie tiem kādus bezkaunīgus cilvēkus no zemiskākās kārtas un sapulcēja grupu, un cēla kņadu visā pilsētā, un uzbruka Jasona namam, un meklēja tos izvest pie ļaudīm.

17.en: 6 And when they found them not, they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also;
17.lv: 6 Un, kad tie tos neatrada, tie vilka Jasonu un kādus brāļus pie pilsētas valdniekiem saukdami, Šie, kas pasauli ir apgriezuši otrādi, ir nākuši arī šurp;

17.en: 7 Whom Jason hath received: and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.
17.lv: 7 Kurus Jasons ir pieņēmis: un šie visi dara pretī Cēzara lēmumiem sacīdami, ka ir cits ķēniņš, kāds Jēzus.

17.en: 8 And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.
17.lv: 8 Un tie iztrūcināja ļaudis un pilsētas valdniekus, kad tie šo dzirdēja.

17.en: 9 And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.
17.lv: 9 Un, kad tie bija ņēmuši nodrošinājumu no Jasona un no citiem, tie tos palaida.

17.en: 10 And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea: who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews.
17.lv:
10

Un brāļi uzreiz sūtīja Pāvilu un Sīlu pa nakti prom uz Bereju: kuri turp nākdami iegāja jūdu sinagogā.

17.en: 11 These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness of mind, and searched the scriptures daily, whether those things were so.
17.lv: 11 Šie bija cildenāki par tiem Tesalonikā tajā, ka tie vārdu uzņēma ar visu prāta gatavību un ikdienas izmeklēja rakstus, vai tas tā bija.

17.en: 12 Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, and of men, not a few.
17.lv: 12 Tāpēc daudzi no tiem ticēja; arī no cienījamām sievietēm, kas bija grieķietes, un no vīriešiem ne mazums.

17.en: 13 But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people.
