26.en: 2 I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:
26.lv: 2 Es sevi uzskatu [par] laimīgu, ķēniņ Agripa, tāpēc ka es šodien par sevi atbildēšu tavā priekšā attiecībā uz visu to, par ko es no jūdiem tieku apsūdzēts:

26.en: 3 Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
26.lv: 3 Īpaši tāpēc ka es zinu tevi esam lietpratēju visās paražās un jautājumos, kas ir starp jūdiem: tādēļ es tevi lūdzos klausīties mani pacietīgi.

26.en: 4 My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;
26.lv: 4 Manu dzīvesveidu no manas jaunības, kas bija vispirms manas paša tautas vidū Jeruzālemē, zina visi jūdi;

26.en: 5 Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
26.lv: 5 Kas mani zina no iesākuma, ja tie grib apliecināt, ka pēc stingrākās mūsu reliģijas sektas es dzīvoju [kā] farizejs.

26.en: 6 And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers:
26.lv: 6 Un nu es stāvu un tieku tiesāts par apsolījuma cerību, [ko] Dievs solījis mūsu tēviem:

26.en: 7 Unto which promise our twelve tribes, instantly serving God day and night, hope to come. For which hope's sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews.
26.lv: 7 Pie kura apsolījuma mūsu divpadsmit ciltis, dedzīgi Dievam kalpodamas dienu un nakti, cer nākt. Kuras cerības dēļ, ķēniņ Agripa, es tieku apsūdzēts no jūdiem.

26.en: 8 Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?
26.lv: 8 Kāpēc jūs to domājat kā kaut ko neticamu, ka Dievs uzceltu mirušos?

26.en: 9I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
26.lv: 9 Es patiesi domāju pie sevis, ka man daudz jādara pretī Jēzus no Nācaretes vārdam.

26.en: 10Which thing I also did in Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against them.
26.lv: 10 Ko es arī darīju Jeruzālemē: un daudzus no svētajiem es ieslēdzu cietumā, saņēmis autoritāti no virspriesteriem; un, kad tie bija nonāvēti, es pret tiem devu savu balsi.

26.en: 11And I punished them oft in every synagogue, and compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto strange cities.
26.lv: 11 Un es tos bieži sodīju ikvienā sinagogā un tos spiedu zaimot; un būdams pārmērīgi nikns pret tiem, es tos vajāju līdz pat svešām pilsētām.

26.en: 12 Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,
26.lv: 12 Kā dēļ es gāju uz Damasku ar autoritāti un uzdevumu no virspriesteriem,

26.en: 13 At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them which journeyed with me.
26.lv: 13 Dienas vidū, ak, ķēniņ, es ceļā redzēju gaismu no debess, pār saules spožumu, spīdam ap mani un tiem, kas ceļoja ar mani.

26.en: 14 And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.
26.lv: 14 Un, kad mēs visi bijām krituši pie zemes, es dzirdēju balsi runājam uz mani un sakām ebreju mēlē, Saul, Saul, kāpēc tu mani vajā? grūti tev spārdīt pret dzinuļiem.

26.en: 15 And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
26.lv: 15 Un es sacīju, Kas tu esi, Kungs? Un viņš sacīja, Es esmu Jēzus, kuru tu vajā.

26.en: 16 But rise, and stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee;
26.lv: 16 Bet celies un stāvi uz savām kājām: jo es tev šajā nolūkā esmu parādījies, iecelt tevi par kalpotāju un liecinieku gan par tām lietām, ko tu esi redzējis, gan par tām lietām, kurās es tev parādīšos;

26.en: 17 Delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee,
26.lv: 17 Izpestīdams tevi no ļaudīm un no pagāniem, pie kuriem es tagad tevi sūtu,

26.en: 18 To open their eyes, and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins, and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.
26.lv: 18 Atvērt viņu acis un griezt viņus no tumsas uz gaismu, un no Sātana varas pie Dieva, lai tie var saņemt grēku piedošanu un mantojumu starp tiem, kas ir svētdarīti caur ticību, kas ir manī.

26.en: 19 Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:
26.lv: 19 Pēc kā, ak, ķēniņ Agripa, es nebiju nepaklausīgs debesu redzējumam:

26.en: 20 But shewed first unto them of Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the coasts of Judaea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.
26.lv: 20 Bet pavēstīju vispirms tiem no Damaskas un Jeruzālemē, un pa visām Jūdejas robežām, un tad pagāniem, ka tiem jānožēlo [grēki] un jāgriežas pie Dieva, un jādara nožēlai atbilstoši darbi.

26.en: 21 For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to kill me.
26.lv: 21 Šo iemeslu dēļ jūdi mani ķēra templī un mani grasījās nogalināt.

26.en: 22 Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come:
26.lv: 22 Tāpēc ieguvis palīdzību no Dieva, es turpinu līdz šai dienai, liecinādams gan maziem, gan lieliem, nesacīdams neko citu, kā to, ko pravieši un Mozus sacīja, [kam] jānāk:

26.en: 23 That Christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the Gentiles.
26.lv: 23 Ka Kristum jācieš un ka viņam jābūt pirmajam, kas ceļas no mirušajiem un jārāda gaisma ļaudīm un pagāniem.

26.en: 24 And as he thus spake for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad.
26.lv: 24 Un viņam tā runājot par sevi, Festus ar skaļu balsi sacīja, Pāvil, tu esi ārprātīgs; daudz mācīšanās tevi padara traku.

26.en: 25 But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.
26.lv: 25 Bet viņš sacīja, Es neesmu traks, cildenākais Festu; bet izrunāju patiesības un skaidrības vārdus.

26.en: 26 For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner.
26.lv: 26 Jo ķēniņš par šo zina, kura priekšā es arī brīvi runāju: jo es esmu pārliecināts, ka nekas no šī viņam nav paslēpts; jo šī lieta netika darīta stūrī.

26.en: 27 King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.
26.lv: 27 Ķēniņ Agripa, vai tu tici praviešiem? es zinu, ka tu tici.

26.en: 28 Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.
26.lv: 28 Tad Agripa Pāvilam sacīja, Gandrīz tu mani pārliecini būt par kristieti.

26.en: 29 And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.
26.lv: 29 Un Pāvils sacīja, es gribētu pie Dieva, ka ne tikai tu, bet arī visi, kas mani šodien dzird, būtu gandrīz un kopumā tādi kā es esmu, kā vien bez šīm saitēm.

26.en: 30 And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:
26.lv: 30 Un, kad viņš tā bija runājis, ķēniņš piecēlās, un pārvaldnieks, un Bernice, un tie, kas ar tiem sēdēja:

26.en: 31 And when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.
26.lv: 31 Un, kad tie bija gājuši sānis, tie sarunājās savā starpā sacīdami, Šis cilvēks nedara neko nāves vai saišu cienīgu.

26.en: 32 Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.
26.lv: 32 Tad Agripa Festum sacīja, Šis cilvēks varētu tikt atbrīvots, ja viņš nebūtu apelējis pie Cēzara.

27.en: 1 And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius, a centurion of Augustus' band.
27.lv: 1 Un, kad bija nospriests, ka mums jākuģo uz Itāliju, tie Pāvilu un kādus citus ieslodzītos nodeva vienam vārdā Jūlijs, centurionam no Augusta grupas.

27.en: 2 And entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.
27.lv: 2 Un iekāpdami Adramitēnas kuģī, mēs nolaidām ūdenī, domādami kuģot gar Āzijas robežām; Aristarkam, maķedonietim no Tesalonikas, esot ar mums.

27.en: 3 And the next day we touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously entreated Paul, and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.
27.lv: 3 Un nākamajā dienā mēs piestājām Sidonā. Un Jūlijs pret Pāvilu izturējās laipni un deva viņam vaļu iet pie saviem draugiem un sevi atspirdzināt.

27.en: 4 And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
27.lv: 4 Un, kad mēs no turienes bijām atlaiduši, mēs kuģojām aiz Kipras, tāpēc ka vēji bija pretī.

27.en: 5 And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
27.lv: 5 Un, kad mēs bijām burājuši pāri Cilīcijas un Pamfīlijas jūrai, mēs nācām uz Miru, Licijas pilsētu.

27.en: 6 And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; and he put us therein.
27.lv: 6 Un tur centurions atrada Aleksandrijas kuģi, kuģojam uz Itāliju; un viņš mūs tajā ielika.

27.en: 7 And when we had sailed slowly many days, and scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under Crete, over against Salmone;
27.lv: 7 Un, kad mēs bijām lēnām burājuši daudzas dienas un tik tikko nākuši iepretī Knidai, vējam mums neļaujot, mēs burājām aiz Krētas iepretī Salmonei;

27.en: 8 And, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.
27.lv: 8 Un, grūti braucot tai garām, nācām uz vietu, kas tiek saukta Labās ostas; tuvu, kur bija Lasejas pilsēta.

27.en: 9 Now when much time was spent, and when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Paul admonished them,
27.lv: 9 Kad nu bija pagājis daudz laika un kad nu burāšana bija bīstama, tāpēc ka gavēnis nu jau bija pagājis, Pāvils tos pamācīja,

27.en: 10 And said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.
27.lv: 10 Un tiem sacīja, Vīri, es nomanu, ka šis brauciens būs ar kaitējumu un daudz bojājumiem, ne tikai kravai un kuģim, bet arī mūsu dzīvībām.

27.en: 11 Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Paul.
27.lv: 11 Neraugoties uz to, centurions vairāk ticēja kuģa saimniekam un īpašniekam nekā tam, ko runāja Pāvils.

27.en: 12 And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, and there to winter; which is an haven of Crete, and lieth toward the south west and north west.
27.lv: 12 Un tāpēc ka osta nebija plaša pārziemošanai, lielākā daļa ieteica aizbraukt arī no turienes, lai kādā veidā tie varētu aizsniegt Fenici un pārziemotu tur; kas ir Krētas osta un pavērsta uz dienvidrietumiem un ziemeļrietumiem.

27.en: 13 And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete.
27.lv: 13 Un, kad dienvidu vējš viegli pūta, pieņemdami, ka tie ir ieguvuši savu nodomu, atlaizdami no turienes, tie burāja blakus Krētai.

27.en: 14 But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.
27.lv: 14 Bet ne ilgi pēc tam pret to cēlās aukains vējš, saukts Eiroklidons.

27.en: 15 And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive.
27.lv: 15 Un, kad kuģis tika saķerts un nevarēja pastāvēt vējā, mēs to atlaidām.

27.en: 16 And running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat:
27.lv: 16 Un kuģojot aiz kādas salas, kas tiek saukta Klauda, mums bija daudz darba, lai savaldītu laivu:

27.en: 17 Which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; and, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.
27.lv: 17 Ko, kad tie bija pacēluši, tie izmantoja troses, apjozdami kuģi; un baidīdamies, lai tie neiekristu plūstošajās smiltīs, nolaida buras un tā tika nēsāti.

27.en: 18 And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next day they lightened the ship;
27.lv: 18 Un mums tiekot ārkārtīgi mētātiem ar auku, nākamajā dienā tie atviegloja kuģi;

27.en: 19 And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.
27.lv: 19 Un trešajā dienā mēs ar savām pašu rokām izmetām kuģa piederumus.

27.en: 20 And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, and no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was then taken away.
27.lv: 20 Un, kad daudzas dienas nedz saule, ne zvaigznes neparādījās, un ne maza auka mums spiedās virsū, tad visa cerība, ka mēs tiktu izglābti, tika ņemta prom.

27.en: 21 But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them, and said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, and not have loosed from Crete, and to have gained this harm and loss.
27.lv: 21 Bet pēc ilgas neēšanas Pāvils nostājās to vidū un sacīja, Vīri, jums vajadzēja mani uzklausīt un neatlaist no Krētas, un neiegūt šo kaitējumu un zaudējumu.

27.en: 22 And now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of any man's life among you, but of the ship.
27.lv: 22 Un nu es jūs pamudinu turēt drošu prātu: jo starp jums neviens nezaudēs dzīvību, kā tikai kuģis.

27.en: 23 For there stood by me this night the angel of God, whose I am, and whom I serve,
27.lv: 23 Jo šajā naktī man blakus stāvēja Dieva, kuram es piederu un kuram es kalpoju, eņģelis

27.en: 24 Saying, Fear not, Paul; thou must be brought before Caesar: and, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.
27.lv: 24 Sacīdams, Nebīsties, Pāvil; tev jātiek vestam Cēzara priekšā: un, rau, Dievs tev ir devis visus tos, kas kuģo ar tevi.

27.en: 25 Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.
27.lv: 25 Tādēļ, vīri, turiet drošu prātu: jo es ticu Dievam, ka tas būs gluži kā tas man tika stāstīts.

27.en: 26 Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.
27.lv: 26 Taču mums jātiek izmestiem uz kādas salas.

27.en: 27 But when the fourteenth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country;
27.lv: 27 Bet, kad četrpadsmitā nakts bija nākusi, mums Adrijā tiekot nēsātiem uz augšu un leju, ap pusnakti kuģinieki uzskatīja, ka tie tuvojas kādai zemei;

27.en: 28 And sounded, and found it twenty fathoms: and when they had gone a little further, they sounded again, and found it fifteen fathoms.
27.lv: 28 Un iegremdēja loti un atrada divdesmit asis: un, kad tie bija braukuši nedaudz tālāk, tie atkal iegremdēja loti un atrada piecpadsmit asis.

27.en: 29 Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, and wished for the day.
27.lv: 29 Tad baidīdamies, lai mēs neuzkristu uz klintīm, tie no pakaļgala izmeta četrus enkurus un vēlējās dienu.

27.en: 30 And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship,
27.lv: 30 Un kuģiniekiem grasoties bēgt no kuģa, kad tie jūrā bija nolaiduši laivu, izlikdamies it kā tie no priekšgala grasītos nomest enkurus,

27.en: 31 Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved.
27.lv: 31 Pāvils centurionam un karavīriem sacīja, Ja vien šie nepaliek kuģī, jūs nevarat tikt glābti.

27.en: 32 Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.
27.lv: 32 Tad karavīri nogrieza laivas virves un ļāva tai nokrist.

27.en: 33 And while the day was coming on, Paul besought them all to take meat, saying, This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting, having taken nothing.
27.lv: 33 Un kamēr nāca diena, Pāvils tos visus lūdzās ņemt barību sacīdams, Šī diena ir četrpadsmitā diena, kad jūs esat uzkavējušies un palikuši gavēdami, neko neņemdami.

27.en: 34 Wherefore I pray you to take some meat: for this is for your health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you.
27.lv: 34 Tādēļ es jūs lūdzu ņemt kādu barību: jo šis ir jūsu veselībai: jo nevienam no jums mats no galvas nenokritīs.

27.en: 35 And when he had thus spoken, he took bread, and gave thanks to God in presence of them all: and when he had broken it, he began to eat.
27.lv: 35 Un, kad viņš tā bija runājis, viņš ņēma maizi un pateicās Dievam to visu klātbūtnē: un, kad viņš to bija lauzis, viņš sāka ēst.

27.en: 36 Then were they all of good cheer, and they also took some meat.
27.lv: 36 Tad tie visi bija drošā prātā, un tie arī ņēma kādu barību.

27.en: 37 And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.
27.lv: 37 Un mēs kuģī pavisam kopā bijām divsimt septiņdesmit dvēseles.

27.en: 38 And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, and cast out the wheat into the sea.
27.lv: 38 Un, kad tie bija pietiekoši ēduši, tie atviegloja kuģi un kviešus izmeta jūrā.

27.en: 39 And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship.
27.lv: 39 Un, kad bija diena, tie nepazina zemi: bet tie atklāja kādu līci ar krastu, kurā tie domāja, ja tas būtu iespējams, iegrūst kuģi.

27.en: 40 And when they had taken up the anchors, they committed themselves unto the sea, and loosed the rudder bands, and hoised up the mainsail to the wind, and made toward shore.
27.lv: 40 Un, kad tie bija pacēluši enkurus, tie nodevās jūrai un atlaida stūres siksnas, un pavērsa grotburu pa vējam, un virzījās pret krastu.

27.en: 41 And falling into a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; and the forepart stuck fast, and remained unmoveable, but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves.
27.lv: 41 Un krizdami vietā, kur divas jūras satikās, tie [ar] kuģi uzskrēja uz sēkļa; un priekšgals uzsēdās un palika nekustināms, bet aizmugurējais gals tika salauzts ar viļņu vardarbību.

27.en: 42 And the soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.
27.lv: 42 Un karavīru padoms bija nogalināt ieslodzītos, lai neviens no tiem neizpeldētu un neizbēgtu.

27.en: 43 But the centurion, willing to save Paul, kept them from their purpose; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea, and get to land:
27.lv: 43 Bet centurions, gribēdams glābt Pāvilu, viņus atturēja no viņu nodoma; un pavēlēja, lai tie, kas varēja peldēt, pirmie mestos jūrā un nokļūtu uz zemes:

27.en: 44 And the rest, some on boards, and some on broken pieces of the ship. And so it came to pass, that they escaped all safe to land.
27.lv: 44 Un pārējie — daži uz dēļiem un daži uz kuģa atlūzām. Un tā notika, ka tie visi droši izbēga uz zemi.

28.en: 1 And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita.
28.lv: 1 Un, kad tie bija izbēguši, tie uzzināja, ka sala tika saukta Melita.

28.en: 2 And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.
28.lv: 2 Un barbari mums rādīja ne mazu laipnību: jo tie iekūra uguni un uzņēma ikvienu no mums esošā lietus un aukstuma dēļ.

28.en: 3 And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laid them on the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fastened on his hand.
28.lv: 3 Un, kad Pāvils bija savācis žagaru saišķi un tos licis uz uguns, no karstuma iznāca odze, un pieķērās viņa rokai.

28.en: 4 And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live.
28.lv: 4 Un, kad barbari redzēja indīgo zvēru karājamies pie viņa rokas, tie savā starpā sacīja, Bez šaubām, šis cilvēks ir slepkava, kuram, kaut arī viņš ir izglābies [no] jūras, tomēr atriebība neļauj dzīvot.

28.en: 5 And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.
28.lv: 5 Un viņš nopurināja zvēru ugunī un nejuta kaitējumu.

28.en: 6 Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.
28.lv: 6 Taču tie gaidīja, kad viņš uztūktu vai pēkšņi nokristu miris: bet, kad tie labu laiku bija gaidījuši un neredzēja viņam nākam kaitējumu, tie pārdomāja un sacīja, ka viņš ir dievs.

28.en: 7 In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.
28.lv: 7 Tajās daļās bija salas galvenā īpašumi, kura vārds bija Publijs; kurš mūs uzņēma un mūs laipni izmitināja trīs dienas.

28.en: 8 And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.
28.lv: 8 Un notika, ka Publija tēvs gulēja slims ar drudzi un dizentēriju: pie kura Pāvils ienāca un lūdza, un lika uz viņa savas rokas, un viņu dziedināja.

28.en: 9 So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:
28.lv: 9 Tā, kad šis tika darīts, arī citi, kuriem salā bija slimības, nāca un tika dziedināti:

28.en: 10 Who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they laded us with such things as were necessary.
28.lv: 10 Kuri arī mūs godāja ar daudz godiem; un, kad mēs aizgājām, tie mūs apkrāva ar to, kas bija vajadzīgs.

28.en: 11 And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.
28.lv: 11 Un pēc trīs mēnešiem mēs aizbraucām Aleksandrijas kuģī, kas bija pārziemojis salā, kura zīme bija Kastors un Polukss.

28.en: 12 And landing at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.
28.lv: 12 Un piestādami Sirakūzās, mēs tur uzkavējāmies trīs dienas.

28.en: 13 And from thence we fetched a compass, and came to Rhegium: and after one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to Puteoli:
28.lv: 13 Un no turienes mēs braucām apkārt un nācām uz Regiju: un pēc vienas dienas pūta dienvidu vējš un nākamajā dienā mēs nācām uz Puteolu:

28.en: 14 Where we found brethren, and were desired to tarry with them seven days: and so we went toward Rome.
28.lv: 14 Kur mēs atradām brāļus un tikām lūgti ar tiem uzkavēties septiņas dienas: un tā mēs devāmies uz Romu.

28.en: 15 And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.
28.lv: 15 Un no turienes, kad brāļi par mums dzirdēja, tie nāca mūs satikt līdz Apija forumam un Trīs tavernām: kurus kad Pāvils redzēja, viņš pateicās Dievam un iedrošinājās.

28.en: 16 And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.
28.lv: 16 Un, kad mēs nācām uz Romu, centurions ieslodzītos nodeva sardzes kapteinim: bet Pāvilam tika ļauts mājot vienam pašam ar karavīru, kas viņu sargāja.

28.en: 17 And it came to pass, that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together: and when they were come together, he said unto them, Men and brethren, though I have committed nothing against the people, or customs of our fathers, yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.
28.lv: 17 Un notika, ka pēc trīs dienām Pāvils aicināja kopā galvenos no jūdiem: un, kad tie bija nākuši kopā, viņš tiem sacīja, Vīri un brāļi, kaut arī es neesmu neko izdarījis pret ļaudīm vai mūsu tēvu paražām, tomēr es [kā] ieslodzītais tiku no Jeruzālemes nodots romiešu rokās.

28.en: 18 Who, when they had examined me, would have let me go, because there was no cause of death in me.
28.lv: 18 Kuri, kad tie mani bija izmeklējuši, grasījās mani palaist, tāpēc ka manī nebija nāves iemesla.

28.en: 19 But when the Jews spake against it, I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of.
28.lv: 19 Bet, kad jūdi tam runāja pretī, es tiku spiests apelēt pie Cēzara; ne ka man būtu kaut kas, par ko apsūdzēt manu tautu.

28.en: 20 For this cause therefore have I called for you, to see you, and to speak with you: because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.
28.lv: 20 Šī iemesla dēļ tāpēc es esmu aicinājis pēc jums, lai jūs redzētu un uz jums runātu: tāpēc ka Israēla cerības dēļ es esmu saistīts ar šo ķēdi.

28.en: 21 And they said unto him, We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee.
28.lv: 21 Un tie viņam sacīja, Mēs nedz saņēmām vēstules no Jūdejas par tevi, nedz kāds no brāļiem, kas nāca, pavēstīja vai runāja kādu kaitējumu par tevi.

28.en: 22 But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against.
28.lv: 22 Bet mēs vēlamies dzirdēt no tevis, ko tu domā: jo par šo sektu mēs zinām, ka ikvienā vietā tai tiek runāts pretī.

28.en: 23 And when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into his lodging; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus, both out of the law of Moses, and out of the prophets, from morning till evening.
28.lv: 23 Un, kad tie viņam bija noteikuši dienu, viņa mītnē pie viņa nāca daudzi; kuriem viņš izskaidroja un apliecināja Dieva valstību, no rīta līdz vakaram tos pārliecinādams par Jēzu gan no Mozus likuma, gan no praviešiem.

28.en: 24 And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.
28.lv: 24 Un daži ticēja tam, kas tika runāts, un daži neticēja.

28.en: 25 And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers,
28.lv: 25 Un, kad tie nevienojās savā starpā, tie aizgāja pēc tam, kad Pāvils bija runājis vienu vārdu, Labi Svētais Gars runāja caur pravieti Esaju uz mūsu tēviem

28.en: 26 Saying, Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:
28.lv: 26 Sacīdams, Ej pie šiem ļaudīm un saki, Dzirdēdami jūs dzirdēsiet un nesapratīsiet; un redzēdami jūs redzēsiet un nenomanīsiet:

28.en: 27 For the heart of this people is waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes have they closed; lest they should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.
28.lv: 27 Jo šo ļaužu sirds ir kļuvusi tukla, un viņu ausis ir trulas dzirdēt, un savas acis tie ir aizvēruši; lai tie neredzētu ar savām acīm un nedzirdētu ar savām ausīm, un nesaprastu ar savu sirdi, un netiktu pārvērsti, un es tos nedziedinātu.

28.en: 28 Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles, and that they will hear it.
28.lv: 28 Tāpēc lai jums ir zināms, ka Dieva glābšana ir sūtīta pagāniem un ka tie to dzirdēs.

28.en: 29 And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.
28.lv: 29 Un, kad viņš bija sacījis šos vārdus, jūdi aizgāja, un [tiem] bija liela spriešana savā starpā.

28.en: 30 And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, and received all that came in unto him,
28.lv: 30 Un Pāvils divus pilnus gadus mājoja savā paša īrētā namā un uzņēma visus, kas pie viņa ienāca,

28.en: 31 Preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.
28.lv: 31 Sludinādams Dieva valstību un mācīdams to, kas attiecas uz Kungu Jēzu Kristu, ar visu pārliecību, nevienam viņam [to] neaizliedzot.
